circumstances: On a cargo flight from Salmon to Indian Creek, the pilot made a detour to fly over a large game as the passenger was an avid hunter. While cruising at low altitude and low speed, the single engine airplane stalled, crashed and burst into flames. Both occupants were killed.
probable_cause:
Stall after the pilot failed to maintain flying speed. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Unwarranted low flying, 
- High density altitude, about 9,000 feet, 
- The crash site was not on the planned route.
